content:
ğŸš€ Why I Chose Computer Science as My Major #ğŸ“Œ A Love for Mathematics Since Childhood #From a young age, I had a deep passion for mathematics. During my elementary school years, solving problems and working through logical puzzles was something I truly enjoyed. Math helped me develop a structured way of thinking, which later became a strong foundation for my interest in computer science.
ğŸ¤– My First Encounter with Programming #In middle school, I was introduced to robotics programming, and it completely fascinated me. Seeing how I could write code and control a machine was an eye-opening experience. It was during this time that I started exploring the world of computers, and my passion for technology began to grow.
ğŸ” High School: Cybersecurity & Deeper Exploration #As I moved into high school, I started to explore different fields within computer science. I came across cybersecurity through online resources, and it sparked my curiosity. The idea of protecting data, securing systems, and preventing cyber threats was something I found extremely exciting.
In my second year of high school, I chose the Engineering & Computer Science track, which allowed me to dive deeper into coding, networking, and security principles.
ğŸ¯ The Final Decision: Choosing IMSIU #By my final year of high school, I knew that computer science was the right path for me. I started researching the best CS programs in Saudi Arabia, and after careful consideration, I found that Imam Muhammad ibn Saud Islamic University (IMSIU) had one of the strongest Computer Science programs in the country.
With its high academic standards and strong curriculum, IMSIU was the perfect choice for my CS journey.
ğŸš€ Looking Ahead: My Goals in CS #Now, as a Computer Science student, I am excited about the future and plan to explore:
ğŸ›¡ï¸ Cybersecurity â€“ Learning about ethical hacking and system protection. ğŸ¤– Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning â€“ Understanding how intelligent systems work. ğŸ’» Software Development â€“ Creating impactful applications and solutions. Choosing Computer Science has been one of the best decisions of my life, and I look forward to growing in this field every day!
ğŸ“Œ Final Thoughts #Computer Science is a field full of opportunities, creativity, and problem-solving. Whether you love math, programming, AI, cybersecurity, or networking, there is something for everyone!
ğŸš€ If you’re considering CS as a major, explore its different fields, find your passion, and start your journey!
title: MyCyberSecurityJourney

content:
ğŸš€ My Cybersecurity Journey #ğŸ” How It All Started #My journey into cybersecurity began during high school when I first discovered the field through online resources. I was fascinated by how security experts protect systems, detect vulnerabilities, and safeguard data.
To get started, I turned to YouTube, where I found valuable tips on how to begin learning cybersecurity. I quickly realized that setting clear goals and following structured steps was essential for success.
ğŸ¯ Setting My Goal & Taking My First Steps #Determined to build my skills, I set a goal to learn cybersecurity systematically and earn industry-recognized certifications. I began my journey with online courses and hands-on practice.
ğŸ“Œ My First Cybersecurity Certification #I took my first official step by enrolling in a course on Coursera, offered by IBM. The course, Introduction to Cybersecurity Tools, provided a solid foundation in cybersecurity principles, tools, and best practices. Earning this certificate gave me confidence to continue my learning journey.
ğŸ“š Expanding My Knowledge with Tuwaiq Academy #To deepen my understanding, I joined Tuwaiq Academy, where I dedicated nearly eight months of learning over a span of two years. This experience allowed me to gain hands-on experience in:
Network security & penetration testing Incident response & ethical hacking Web application security & exploit development The structured learning environment helped me solidify my skills and prepare for more advanced challenges in cybersecurity.
ğŸ† Achieving My Biggest Milestone: EwAPT Certification #One of my proudest achievements in my cybersecurity journey was earning the eWAPT (Web Application Penetration Tester) Certification. This certification was a significant milestone that tested my skills in web security, vulnerability assessment, and penetration testing. It required dedication, practice, and hands-on labs, but the hard work paid off.
ğŸ® Competing in CTF Challenges with BlackHat #As I continued learning, I wanted to apply my skills in real-world scenarios. I started participating in Capture The Flag (CTF) competitions, where cybersecurity enthusiasts solve security-related challenges.
One of the most exciting experiences was joining BlackHat CTF competitions, which allowed me to:
Think like an ethical hacker Apply problem-solving skills in cybersecurity Collaborate with security experts and teams The thrill of hacking, solving puzzles, and learning from real-world scenarios keeps me motivated to continue improving my skills.
ğŸš€ The Journey Continues #Cybersecurity is a constantly evolving field, and my journey is far from over. I plan to:
Earn more advanced cybersecurity certifications. Dive deeper into red teaming & penetration testing. Continue competing in CTFs and contributing to the cybersecurity community. Every step Iâ€™ve taken so far has reinforced my passion for cybersecurity. Iâ€™m excited about whatâ€™s ahead and committed to learning, growing, and making an impact in the field.
ğŸ“Œ Final Thoughts #Cybersecurity is not just about knowledge; itâ€™s about hands-on practice, persistence, and continuous learning. If you’re interested in getting started, set your goal, take small steps, and never stop learning!
ğŸš€ The journey never stops, and Iâ€™m looking forward to achieving even bigger milestones in the future!
title: WhyIChoosedCS

content:
ğŸ“ Addvises for New CS Students #ğŸŒŸ Introduction #Starting your journey in Computer Science (CS) can be exciting yet overwhelming. Whether you’re aiming to become a software engineer, data scientist, cybersecurity expert, or AI specialist, the first steps are crucial in shaping your learning experience. Here are some key tips and advice to help new CS students navigate their academic and professional paths effectively! ğŸš€
ğŸ“Œ 1. Master the Fundamentals #Before diving into advanced topics, ensure you have a strong foundation in these areas:
ğŸ–¥ï¸ Programming Basics â€“ Start with languages like Python, C, or Java. ğŸ”¢ Data Structures & Algorithms â€“ Essential for problem-solving and coding interviews. ğŸ’» Computer Architecture & Operating Systems â€“ Understand how computers work under the hood. ğŸ”— Networking & Databases â€“ Key skills for backend development. Invest time in understanding logic, problem-solving, and efficient coding techniques as they will be your building blocks for advanced topics.
ğŸ› ï¸ 2. Learn Git and Version Control #Collaboration is an essential part of software development, and Git is a must-have skill:
âœ… Use GitHub or GitLab to host your projects. âœ… Learn basic Git commands (git init, git add ., git commit -m, git push origin main). âœ… Work on open-source projects to enhance your coding and teamwork skills. Knowing Git will help you manage your code, track changes, and collaborate with other developers efficiently.
ğŸ—ï¸ 3. Build Real-World Projects #The best way to solidify your knowledge is by applying what you learn. Try to:
ğŸ”¹ Create small projects like to-do lists, calculators, or portfolio websites. ğŸ”¹ Work on larger projects such as web applications, mobile apps, or data analysis scripts. ğŸ”¹ Participate in hackathons, coding competitions, and open-source contributions. A well-structured GitHub portfolio filled with projects will help you stand out when applying for internships or jobs.
ğŸ“š 4. Use Reliable Learning Resources #There are countless learning platforms, but here are some of the best:
ğŸ“– CS Theory & Algorithms â†’ MIT OpenCourseWare, GeeksforGeeks, Khan Academy ğŸ–¥ï¸ Programming & Software Development â†’ freeCodeCamp, Codecademy, LeetCode ğŸ“Š Data Science & AI â†’ Kaggle, Coursera, Fast.ai Pro Tip: Follow tech YouTube channels, podcasts, and blogs to stay updated with the latest trends!
ğŸ† 5. Get Comfortable with Problem-Solving #To succeed in CS, practice problem-solving daily:
ğŸ… Start with easy coding challenges on HackerRank and Codeforces. ğŸ¯ Move on to intermediate and advanced problems on LeetCode and CodeSignal. ğŸ† Compete in coding contests to sharpen your skills and speed. Mastering DSA (Data Structures & Algorithms) will give you an edge in technical interviews.
ğŸ¤ 6. Network and Join Communities #Building a strong network will open doors to opportunities:
ğŸ¤ Join CS clubs and student organizations at your university. ğŸ’¬ Participate in tech forums and online communities like Stack Overflow and Reddit. ğŸŸï¸ Attend coding bootcamps, meetups, and conferences. Networking helps you learn from others, discover job/internship opportunities, and stay motivated.
ğŸ“Œ 7. Stay Curious and Keep Learning #Technology evolves fast, and continuous learning is key! ğŸš€
ğŸ” Explore new programming languages and frameworks. ğŸ“ Read tech blogs, research papers, and industry news. ğŸ“– Enroll in online courses and certifications to upskill. A growth mindset will help you adapt and excel in the dynamic field of computer science.
ğŸ¯ Final Thoughts #Starting in CS can feel overwhelming, but with the right approach, persistence, and curiosity, you’ll thrive! Focus on building projects, networking, and sharpening your problem-solving skills. Remember, success in CS is about consistent learning and hands-on experience. ğŸš€
Best of luck on your Computer Science journey! ğŸ”¥ğŸ’¡
title: Addvises_for_newCS_Students

content:
ğŸš€ My Journey with Git #ğŸŒŸ How I Got Introduced to Git #I was introduced to Git through a three-day bootcamp organized by the TeachNation club at the College of Computer Science, Imam Muhammad ibn Saud Islamic University. Before joining the bootcamp, I had heard about Git but never really understood its significance. Over the past few days, Iâ€™ve taken my first steps into this powerful tool, and Iâ€™m excited to share my experience!
ğŸ“… Summary of Git Bootcamp #Day 1: Learned Git fundamentals, Git Bash, basic commands, and how Git stores data. Day 2: Created a Hugo site, set up a blog, and customized the theme. Day 3: Finalized the blog, refined the content, and showcased our projects. This bootcamp was an excellent starting point for mastering Git and static site development. Special thanks to TeachNation and Mr. Abdulaziz for this valuable learning experience! ğŸš€
ğŸŒŸ Why is Git Important? #Git is an essential tool for developers. Here are some reasons why:
ğŸ“ Version Control â€“ Easily track changes in your code. ğŸ¤ Collaboration â€“ Work with teams seamlessly. ğŸ”„ Backup & Safety â€“ No more losing your code! ğŸ› ï¸ Essential Git Commands #If you’re just getting started, here are some basic Git commands you should know:
# Initialize a new Git repository git init # Add all files to the staging area git add . # Commit the changes with a message git commit -m "Initial commit" # View a simplified commit history (one commit per line) git log --oneline # Push the changes to GitHub git push origin main ğŸ“š Reliable Resources to Learn More About Git #If you’re looking to dive deeper into Git, here are some trusted resources:
ğŸ“– Official Documentation & Guides #ğŸ”— Git Official Documentation â€“ Comprehensive explanations of Git commands and workflows. ğŸ”— Pro Git Book â€“ A free, in-depth book covering Git from basics to advanced topics. ğŸ¥ Video Tutorials #ğŸ¬ GitHub Learning Lab â€“ Interactive tutorials for learning Git and GitHub step by step. ğŸ¬ The Net Ninja’s Git & GitHub Crash Course â€“ A beginner-friendly YouTube guide. ğŸ¬ Traversy Media Git Crash Course â€“ A fast and easy introduction to Git. ğŸ› ï¸ Interactive Learning Platforms #ğŸ–¥ï¸ Learn Git Branching â€“ A visual and interactive way to understand Git branches. ğŸ–¥ï¸ GitHub Docs â€“ A great resource for learning GitHub alongside Git. ğŸ“Œ Cheat Sheets & Quick References #ğŸ“‹ Git Cheat Sheet (GitHub) â€“ A quick reference guide for essential Git commands. ğŸ“‹ Atlassian Git Cheat Sheet â€“ A helpful overview of commonly used Git commands. With these resources, you can continue mastering Git and confidently use it in real-world projects! ğŸš€
title: The_Beggening_With_Git
